posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
Without the ability spread, it's not all that obvious.  It may cost an AB pushing EDR3 into the final Grt STR slot depending on whether you can wiggle the starting spread better.  You guys on Arelith have those gifts that can solve problems like this I suppose. With so few levels of WM I doubt the final AB is going to be impressive.

Losing a DwD bonus feat to gain a fighter bonus feat (Ftr8/DwD15 vs. Ftr10/DwD13) doesn't buy you much except perhaps a slightly better selection list.

You have few alternatives, really.  23 levels split between Ftr & DwD can only be juggled so many ways. Of your three pre-epic feats that are not prereqs (KD/BlindFight/ImpCrit), I'd give up KD or IC way before BF.  It's not rocket science.

I recall having similar issues when building Grim Stonefoot - F10/WM7/DwD23 - and that was for 40 levels, and without going an EDR route. I ended up giving him a heavy flail and getting an AB of +47. On reflection, I think Max Kane was probably right (don't tell him I said so) that its too much of an investment in what are effectively redundant prerequisites for only 7 levels of WM, and I suspect that's even more the case with a 30 level cap.

I've tried doing the link to Grim for information, but it doesn't seem to want to play with me at the moment, sorry. I can tell you he's on page 5 of the Full Epic Builds sub-forum, and can be found in Hip's ECB Filter (accessible via the Rules and Tools sub-forum).

Anyway, I wish you well with the build!

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
I'm inclined to go with the Stonefoot starting split and eat the 1 AB.  That'll gain you an open feat where you can fit in Exotic.  You may need to take a non-epic feat during epic levels but such are the trappings of a force-fitted combo like this on a 30 cap server.

The main reason I would never try to play a build like this is the conflict and inefficiencies. 

On the WM side, you are investing in Mobility/Spring Attack/WWA, none of which have any presence while in Defensive Stance, probably the greatest boost a DwD investment offers.  All this just for 1 AB and better crits.  The problem is, all the focus in EDR translates into a pedestrian AB and as I have always tried to remind crit-focused builders... "You've got to HIT, before you can CRIT."  The 7 WM levels begin to head in that direction (reliable AB on the way to many crit opportunities), but then the plan nerfs the potential by minimizing the primary attack ability and number of SWFs.

Take those 3 prereq feats out and you'd be open immediately to your special proficiency plus IKD and Cleave, all with more value than those rare crit boosts.

If the idea appeals to you, then by all means, feed your obsession.  But this combo is a perfect example of a build that is intrinsically fighting itself.
